body:
# Environment

```none
Windows build number: 

Platform ServicePack Version      VersionString
-------- ----------- -------      -------------
 Win32NT             10.0.19041.0 Microsoft Windows NT 10.0.19041.0

Your Distribution version:
Release:        20.04

Whether the issue is on WSL 2 and/or WSL 1:
Linux version 4.19.104-microsoft-standard (oe-user@oe-host) (gcc version 8.2.0 (GCC)) #1 SMP Wed Feb 19 06:37:35 UTC 2020

```

# Steps to reproduce

```
sudo apt-get update
Err:1 https://apt.kubernetes.io kubernetes-xenial InRelease
  Temporary failure resolving 'apt.kubernetes.io'
Err:2 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal InRelease
  Temporary failure resolving 'archive.ubuntu.com'
Err:3 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-security InRelease
  Temporary failure resolving 'security.ubuntu.com'
Err:4 https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk InRelease
  Temporary failure resolving 'packages.cloud.google.com'
Err:5 https://deb.nodesource.com/node_14.x focal InRelease
  Temporary failure resolving 'deb.nodesource.com'
Hit:6 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-updates InRelease
Hit:7 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-backports InRelease
Reading package lists... Done
W: Failed to fetch http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/focal/InRelease  Temporary failure resolving 'archive.ubuntu.com'
W: Failed to fetch http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu/dists/focal-security/InRelease  Temporary failure resolving 'security.ubuntu.com'
W: Failed to fetch https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt/dists/cloud-sdk/InRelease  Temporary failure resolving 'packages.cloud.google.com'
W: Failed to fetch https://apt.kubernetes.io/dists/kubernetes-xenial/InRelease  Temporary failure resolving 'apt.kubernetes.io'
W: Failed to fetch https://deb.nodesource.com/node_14.x/dists/focal/InRelease  Temporary failure resolving 'deb.nodesource.com'
W: Some index files failed to download. They have been ignored, or old ones used instead.```
```

#  Expected behavior

The command should succeed.

# Actual behavior

The command fails due to a DNS resolution problem.

Ping can resolve the hosts, i.e. the problem is limited to `apt-get`.

```
ping archive.ubuntu.com
PING archive.ubuntu.com (91.189.88.152) 56(84) bytes of data.
64 bytes from actiontoad.canonical.com (91.189.88.152): icmp_seq=1 ttl=51 time=36.7 ms
64 bytes from actiontoad.canonical.com (91.189.88.152): icmp_seq=2 ttl=51 time=37.4 ms
```

I use the the autogenerate `resolv.conf`. Changing to a different nameserver fixes the problem.

```
echo nameserver 8.8.8.8 > /tmp/resolv.conf
sudo cp /tmp/resolv.conf /run/resolvconf/resolv.conf
sudo apt-get update
Hit:1 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal InRelease
Hit:2 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-updates InRelease
Hit:3 http://archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-backports InRelease
Hit:4 https://deb.nodesource.com/node_14.x focal InRelease
Hit:5 https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt cloud-sdk InRelease
Hit:6 http://security.ubuntu.com/ubuntu focal-security InRelease
Hit:7 https://packages.cloud.google.com/apt kubernetes-xenial InRelease
Reading package lists... Done
```

Note that also X Windows does not work properly on this setup: https://github.com/microsoft/WSL/issues/4106#issuecomment-638060261
title: DNS Problem with apt-get
